titles.title: HP451 Nearer my God to thee

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
And though it be
A cross that raises me:
Still all my song would be,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee.'

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Though, like the wanderer,
The sun gone down,
Darkness be over me,
My rest a stone;
Yet in my dreams I'd be
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
There let the way appear,
Steps unto heav'n;
All that thou sendest me
In mercy giv'n:
Angels to beckon me
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Then, with my waking thoughts
Bright with thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs
Bethel I'll raise;
So by my woes to be
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Or if on joyful wing
Cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon and stars forgot,
Upwards I fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee.'
